item.title: Football Shout-out: After the match
item.description: Welcome to Football Shout-out from Premier Skills English, where we talk about the language you need when watching a match. Whether you are a super fan or an armchair supporter you won't be able to avoid football on TV this summer. In Football Shout-out, Jack and Rich present useful language to shout at the TV screen when watching a match with or without friends! In this episode, they look at some words and phrases that fans use after a match. Do you know what 'hanging on' means?

item.description:
Welcome to Football Shout-out from Premier Skills English, where we talk about the language you need when watching a match. Whether you are a super fan or an armchair supporter you won't be able to avoid football on TV this summer.
In Football Shout-out, Jack and Rich present useful language to shout at the TV screen when watching a match with or without friends!
In this episode, they look at some words and phrases that fans use when your team is losing and when they have lost. Do you know what 'we were robbed' means?

item.title: Understanding Grammar - Conditionals
item.description:
In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich host their third World Cup podcast. In this podcast, they are going to do two roleplays.
This podcast was recorded on the 20th of June and the roleplays are based on an imaginary result for England's match against Panama. The result sets up the language focus on speculating before and after a football match with a specific emphasis on conditional forms.
Your task is to write about the action at the World Cup and write some conditional sentences about the past and the future. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess and news about our World Cup competition and World Cup programme.
Find all the free learning activities on the website: [https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/course-stages/understanding-grammar-conditionals](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/course-stages/understanding-grammar-conditionals)
Enjoy!
#LearnEnglish #WorldCup #Russia

item.title: Football Shout-out: Missing Chances
item.description:
Welcome to Football Shout-out from Premier Skills English, where we talk about the language you need when watching a match. Whether you are a super fan or an armchair supporter you won't be able to avoid football on TV this summer. In Football Shout-out, Jack and Rich present useful language to shout at the TV screen when watching a match with or without friends! In this episode, they look at some words and phrases that fans shout when an opposition player or someone on their own team misses a chance. Do you know what 'couldn't hit a barn door with a banjo' means? Find all the extra learning materials on the website:
[https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/football-shout-out-missing-chances](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/football-shout-out-missing-chances)

item.title: Learning Vocabulary: Extreme Adjectives
item.description: In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich host their second World Cup podcast. They talk about the surprise result between Mexico and Germany and some of the goals that have been scored in Russia. The language focus is on vocabulary with a specific emphasis on gradable adjectives and non-gradable adjectives or extreme adjectives. Your task is to transform five boring or dull sentences into more exciting or dramatic sentences by adding extreme adjectives. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess and news about our World Cup competition and World Cup programme. Enjoy!

item.title: Understanding Grammar - Making Predictions about the World Cup
item.description:
In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich are talking about the World Cup and make some predictions about the matches, players and fans in Russia. The language focus is on the grammar we use to make predictions. Your task is to use this language to make your own World Cup predictions. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess and news about our World Cup competition and World Cup programme. Enjoy!
Find the lesson and all the activities on the website: [https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/course-stages/understanding-grammar-making-predictions](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/course-stages/understanding-grammar-making-predictions)

item.title: Understanding Grammar - The Past Continuous
item.description:
In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich talk about interruptions and roleplay a situation where the Premier League is stolen from Chelsea football club. Mr De Bruyne is the main suspect! The language focus is on the past continuous and the different ways we can use it to talk about the past. Your task is to use the past continuous to talk about being interrupted while watching a football match. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess. Enjoy!
[Complete the full lesson on the past continuous here.](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/podcasts/understanding-grammar-past-continuous)

Whether you are a super fan or an armchair supporter you won't be able to avoid football on TV this summer. In Football Shout-out, Jack and Rich present useful language to shout at the TV screen when watching a match with or without friends! In this episode, they look at some words and phrases to talk about the other team (the opposition).
You can complete the full lesson and join the community on [Premier Skills English](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/football-shout-out-opposition).

[Let's Sing (ft. George Ellinas with Snowflake)](http://dig.ccmixter.org/files/SackJo22/38362) by [SackJo22](http://dig.ccmixter.org/people/SackJo22) [CC BY 3.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/)

Welcome to Football Shout-out from Premier Skills English, where we talk about the language you need when watching a match. Whether you are a super fan or an armchair supporter you won't be able to avoid football on TV this summer. In Football Shout-out, Jack and Rich present useful language to shout at the TV screen when watching a match with or without friends! In this episode, they look at the language you need when a player commits a foul.

The music from the introduction is:

item.title: Learning Vocabulary: Phrases with go
item.description:
In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich try to describe the offside rule and roleplay five short conversations where they use phrases with go. They look at five different ways of using go and how you can use these phrases in your everyday English. Your task is to use some difficult phrases with go in context. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess. Enjoy!
Learn more and complete the full lesson on [Premier Skills English](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/podcasts/learning-vocabulary-phrases-go).

item.title: Understanding Grammar - a, an, or the
item.description:
In this week's Premier Skills English Podcast, Jack and Rich talk about Indian food (Jack loves it, but Rich is not a big fan). The language focus is on articles (a, an, the) which is an area of English that lots of learners have problems with as they are often used differently in your first language or don't exist at all. More specifically, we are going to focus on how we use articles when we are talking in a general sense and when we are talking about a specific thing. Your task is to complete some sentences and use the correct article. As always, we also have a new football phrase for you to guess. Enjoy!
To complete the lesson, visit the page on Premier Skills English.
[https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/podcasts/understanding-grammar-a-an-or-the](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/podcasts/understanding-grammar-a-an-or-the)

item.title: This week - Matchweek 37
item.description:
Welcome to This Week from Premier Skills English, a weekly review of all the action from the Premier League for learners of English from across the globe. In This Week, Jack and Rich talk about all of the weekend's action in the Premier League; the big headlines and the main talking points. We also ask you to get involved; do you agree with Jack and Rich's choices of best player, best team and best match of Matchweek 37? Make your prediction for next week's big match and tell us how your club or fantasy football team is doing. We welcome comments from all football fans and especially welcome comments from football fans who are learning English.
[https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/week/matchweek-37](https://premierskillsenglish.britishcouncil.org/skills/listen/week/matchweek-37)
